column1: short, wide, flayed on the up through cover point. Sanga still has it. Sanga has always had it. He sees the width and laces it through the line
edged and dropped at second slip. Fuller and closer to off, angling in, straightens away to have Sanga poking at it. Asif Ali at second slip stretches to his right and spills it
back of a length and slanting away outside off, no shot
full and attacking off stump, played back down the pitch
back of a length and darting away outside off, Shehzad throws his bat at the ball... and misses
good length and put on off stump, presses forward and blocks back to Raees
dug short and outside off, Sanga camps back and shovels it across to short midwicket
back of a length and slanting away outside off, slashed away to the right of cover-point
Sami bursts past the outside edge. Good length, angling in, bounces, and seams away past the bat
full on off stump, pushed past the right of Sami to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Shehzad punches on the up and hits it to extra cover
picked off the hips to the right of long leg for a double

Raees has his man now. Asif Ali bends low and makes no mistake this time at first slip. Full and Raees explores the channel outside off, finds movement off the pitch, Sanga hangs his bat out and snicks it behind. Looks like the rain has juiced up the pitch. Rare failure for Sanga
good length and put outside off, Bravo shoulders arms
full and just a shade outside off, Bravo loosens his grip and drops a single to cover
good length and breaks in against the angle, squirted back to the bowler off an inside edge
pitched up on off, draws Shehzad forward, blocked to short cover
good length on off, Shehzad aims the leg side, instead leading-edges it to short cover. He's on 2 off 11 balls
back of a length and angling across off, stabbed on the up past the right of the bowler and left of wide mid-off. First boundary since the first ball
short on the hips, glanced to fine leg
full and probing away just a shade outside off, moves past the outside edge, nearly trimmed the top of off
Shehzad puts bat on ball now, although this is a streaky outside edge that rolls away to deep third man

Sami bounces out Bravo and lets out a big roar. Banged in short at the shoulder, angling away, cramps up Bravo for room. The batsman loses his shape and falls over. The resultant top edge is snaffled by Finn diving forward from short fine leg. The England quick seemed to have misjudged it but then moved in and to his right to recover

Sami goes past the outside edge again. This is neither full nor shot. This is the in-between length. The batsman is neither forward nor back. He is pinned to the crease and watches the ball skirt past the bat. Sami is turning the clock back
full and just a shade outside off, tapped to extra cover off the front foot
short and outside off, Shehzad rides the bounce and jabs it away to the right of deep third man
back of a length and outside off, that's the definition of a crunching dot. Punched on the up to the right of backward point. Shadab throws himself to his right to pounce on the ball
good length and angling into a bunt to mid-on for one
Finn nearly hits 140ks and attacks the off stump, Shehzad's iffy defence intervenes
overpitched at the toes, clipped away to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, Shehzad jumps on top of the bounce and punches to cover-point
Flapped into the lap of Raaes at mid-on. Good length, and nipping away outside off, Maqsood shapes to slug it over midwicket. Instead, he pops a leading edge to Raees. Sami is having a ball in Dubai
back of a length and hits the bat hard as opposed to bat hitting ball. Squirted to the leg side
dug in shorter and outside off, not much room to free the arms. Stabbed to cover-point from the crease
First boundary for Shehzad off his 20th ball, in the last over of Powerplay. Dragged down outside off, Shehzad sat back waiting for this. Pulled away in front of square to the midwicket fence
darted really full on off, pushed back to Sami
good length and angling in at off, keeps a bit low, Malik covers up in defence
rising short ball outside off, Malik rises with it, pats it down, and sets off
Shehzad ventures across off and misses this inswinger, but this is heading past the leg stump. This is more Middlesex than Dubai, and Finn is enjoying it
pitched up and outside off, solidly driven through the line to mid-off
short inducker, seams in, bounces and nearly has Malik chopping on. The ball trickles past the off stump to the keeper
full and angling into the front-foot push between midwicket and mid-on
kicks up from a length outside off and moves past the bat. Excellent carry to the keeper
back of a length and put outside off, run away to backward point. There's also a wide slip in place to stop such dabs
back of a length and outside off, chopped to wide slip. Good plans from Islamabad for Malik
good length on off, Malik chops from the stumps, between backward point and short third man
full and angling in at off, tapped to midwicket for one
back of a length and outside off, uppish dab from Malik but wide of wide slip and down to third man
full and angling into a push to mid-on
Shehzad has been put out of his misery by Finn. Back of a length and climbing onto the hips, Shehzad pulls but can't keep it down. He hits it straight to deep fine leg. A soft innings meet a soft end

there's a deflection, but was it off the bat? Pollard dares to shimmy out. Finn pulls his length back and gets it to nip back in sharply, catches the flap of the pad and carries to the keeper. No bat involved, and hit outside the line
on a length and outside off, Pollard reaches out for the ball with his hands and scoops it in the air to third man
short and just a shade outside off, Malik rides the bounce and plays to backward point
short, wide, laced away to the right of deep third man for two
full and angling away outside off, Pollard belts it in the air straight of mid-on. Dismissive
very full and skids back in off the pitch, the batsman is late onto his leg-side shot and wears it on the pad. The angle was too sharp to threaten the stumps
short and outside off, chopped down to third man
back of a length and outside off, punched up to backward point. You can't get it past Shadab
banged in short outside off, Malik rides the bounce and fends to point
lifter outside off, Pollard lets it go
fullish and outside off, dabbed square through the off side for one
back of a length and slanting into a gentle flick to square leg. Big Pollard races back for the second
full and angling into a full-blooded whip to deep midwicket
short and outside off, jabbed to third man
back of a length and darting away outside off, past the outside edge
big nip-backer, beats the inside edge, and chops Pollard into half. Quality ball to cap a quality spell: 4-0-14-1
pushed through on middle, Malik presses forward and glides it to backward point
Malik gets a move on. He attacks the spinner. Runs down the track, manufactures a half-volley, and launches it over Shadab's head
speared on middle, 95ks, pushed back to the left of Shadab
darted short and wide outside off, chopped to backward point
darted flat on middle and leg, tucked around the corner for one
skiddy googly, breaks back in, beats the inside edge of a helmet-less Pollard and the top of off. The batsman did not pick it and played for the legbreak
short and decks in on off, Malik hops, skips, and chops to point
nails a yorker on off stump, Pollard can do nothing but toe-end it down to long-on
slower cutter, but the length is short, allowing the batsman to pull to deep square leg
length ball on off, swished away between deep midwicket and deep square off the inside half
banged short and outside off, Pollard is late onto the hook, top-edges it behind to the right of keeper
full and wide outside off, Malik slices a drive to square-ish third man
slider on middle, nudged to square leg off the back foot
darted short on a fourth-stump line, Pollard sits back and forces a single down to long-on
floated up on middle, pushed back to the right of Shadab
Malik uses his feet, Shadab drags his length back and cramps the batsman for room. Defended to the leg side
Malik forays down the track again, this time he launches the googly with the break over midwicket. Huuuuge hit. Malik met the pitch and lofted it with great authority
darted on the leg stump, picked off to fine leg for a double
Pollard lays into his WI team-mate. Back of a length and outside off, clubbed across the line over midwicket for another six
on a length and outside off, right in the swinging radar, Pollard clears his front leg and launches it into the top tier
Four boundaries in five balls. This is a top edge but everything counts. Banged in short and outside off, tucks up Pollard, who pulls, and skies it over the keeper

Russell hits back to trap Pollard. It looks pretty adjacent but Pollard asks for a review. This was the change-up offcutter, grips in the surface, and hits the front pad as Pollard hangs back and plays around it. The on-field out decision is vindicated. The tracker returns three reds. Pollard, however, has given this innings a leg-up
rising short ball outside off, dropped in front of point for one
yorker on middle, clipped into the vacant spaces at deep midwicket
back of a length and angling in on middle, tucked away to deep square leg
Malik moves away outside leg, this is a high bouncer outside off, called a wide
Malik gives himself room, Ashraf chases him and keeps him to a single to third man
back of a length and outside off, neatly guided to third man
full and straight, whipped with the wrists to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, swatted in the air to wide long-on. Good running between the wickets
Badar aims a fine scoop but is fooled by this cutter and hit on the thigh
back of a length and outside off, Malik slashes and only collects fresh air

short, wide, possibly an offcutter, nailed straight to backward point. You just can't get it past Shadab - one of the best fielders in the world. Russel has his hands aloft and celebrates. Malik cuts hard but can't keep it down. He had stabilised Multan's innings, who will finish it now?
short and outside off, tip and run to cover

A comedy of errors. This was full on off, nowhere near short to cut. The batsman chops beside his feet, Tanvir sets off for a single. Russell runs in to attack the ball, he aims to throw the stumps down at the non-striker's end but misses. Shadab is frustrated. Mid-on collects the ball. Russell, though, is on the floor, wondering what might have been. He's an excellent fielder in general but misses the chance this time
bouncer on the leg stump, Tanvir ducks under
back of a length and outside off, Tanvir sizes it up and muscles it to the midwicket boundary
full on middle, stabbed to midwicket
slower cutter outside off, inside-edged behind past the keeper
full on middle, stays leg-side of the ball and pumps it to extra cover
middle-stump yorker, squeezed to square leg

112.4ks dipping full-toss, foxes the batsman, and leaves the stumps in a mess. Slower delivery from the back of the hand, look at the sharp dip on the bat. Badar aims to swing across the line but misread the change up. Even if he had read it, I suspect he would have hit it. Great skill from Raees: he can swing the new ball, get it to skid off the pitch, bowl yorkers and slower ones. Gun T20 bolwer
Tahir stays leg-side of the ball and watches this swing and bounce over middle stump
back of a length on off stump, hoicked across the line to deep midwicket
full on off, Tahir stays leg-side of the ball and drives competently through the covers
wide yorker, Tanvir lets it go
very full and outside off, dragged off the inside half to wide long-on

Sami swoops down on the ball, turns around, and throws the stumps down to run out Tanvir. His day keeps getting better. Back of a length on off stump, cramps Tahir for room. He fends it to where short cover may have been. Sami runs in and runs out Tanvir
very full on off, the batsman can't quite get underneath it. Sliced through cover-point
knocked 'em over. Yorker on the leg stump, Tahir backs away, swings wildly, and misses. Excellent T20 bowling from Raees
full and straight, tickled to the off side off an inside edge. That scrape of wood saves the No.11
full and skids in again, pins the pad as the batsman plays across it. Pitched outside leg
off-stump yorker, inside-edged to fine leg
Asif Ali nails a direct hit from deep midwicket. Irfan is caught short on the second. This was really full on off, he can't get under the length and toe-ends it to the deep, where Asif puts on a show
full, angling away, swinging past the outside edge
back of a length and slanting away outside off, ignored this time

Irfan generates extra bounce and away movement to have Ronchi nicking off. Kicks up from a back of a length outside off and nips away, Ronchi wafts with no feet and tickles it behind. Pollard hangs onto a chest-high catch. Perfect start for Multan
back of a length and angling away outside off, stabbed to point
back of a length and angling across off, thumped away square through the off side. Beats deep third man to his right
much fuller and running away outside off, driven to the covers
chipped in the air... but to the right of the bowler. Walton gets away with a soft leading edge
full and angling across off, blocked to the covers
slower cutter, swerves away outside off, past the outside edge
back of a length and outside off, Walton throws his bat at the ball and slashes it on the up over backward point
prodded into the covers
full on the stumps, driven between midwicket and mid-on
back of a length and outside off, sliced to deep third man
punched on the up to the right of short cover and left of mid-off
back of a length and angling away outside off, Walton stretches out and crunnnnnches it between the covers and mid-off
heading into the hips, glanced fine of long leg
the change of angle doesn't matter. Short and holds its line outside off, Walton frees his arms and fiercely punches through point
on a length, angling away, Walton deals with the extra bounce and drops the ball to cover
good length and angling across off, Farhan chases after it and is beaten on the outside edge
short, wide, a swing and a miss from Farhan
overpitched on middle and leg, presses forward and crisply drives between midwicket and mid-on. So easy on the eye
darted onto the pads, tickled fine on the leg side
another leg-side ball, brushes the thigh pad and rolls fine on the leg side past the left of the diving keeper. Multan can't afford such loose balls
short on top of off, Walton gets behind the line and punches up to mid-off
93ks dart outside off, Farhan brings his fast hands into play and crashes the ball through extra cover. He went low and muscled it

Tahir sets off on a celebratory stint. Catch him if you can. Quicker one from Tahir, full and fizzes in, then turns away slightly to beat the outside edge and clatter into off stump. Tahir provides Multan with the breakthrough
googly outside off, but the length is short, allowing the batsman to read it off the pitch and punch to cover
fired on the stumps, defended
fast googly, breaks in on middle, defended
tossed on off, eased down to long-on off the front foot
tapped into the covers off the back foot
full on off, blocked to cover
full and outside off, slices a drive to point
guided from off stump to third man
punched on the up to mid-off
short and angling away outside off, dabbed with the angle to backward point
tossed-up legbreak outside off, driven off the front foot to long-off
wrong'un, skids in, inside-edged onto the front pad, the ball rolls back to the bowler
back of a length on middle, punched up to long-on
slower through the air and breaks away outside off, forward and dabbed to point
slider on off, played back to Tahir from the crease
quicker legbreak, pitches on off, breaks away to fetch the outside edge and run away through vacant slip
back of a length on off stump, swatted to cow corner
back of a length and angling away outside off, Walton swings and makes no contact
pitched up and angling away just outside off, draws Walton forward to drive. The batsman drives with a slicing finish and finds Shehzad at backward point
overpitched on leg stump, put away through midwicket with a lovely flick
back of a length and just a shade outside off, run away to third man
another little dab to third man, this is placed fine of the fielder for two
back of a length on off, glided behind square on the off side

back of a length and bounces outside off, the batsman wafts, and has he nicked it behind? Irfan challenges the on-field not-out decision. Don't think there was bat on that. No deflection, and Ultraedge detects nothing. Ali survives
clipped off the pads to Tahir at long leg
full on off, played up to short cover off the front foot
full and angling in, falls over the flick and is struck on the pad, but this sliding down leg
full on the stumps, whipped to long leg for two
full on middle and leg, presses forward and knocks the ball to midwicket
full on off, tip and run to cover

Oh dear, Maqsood runs in with the ball from mid-on but misses the stumps at the non-striker's end. Flapped to Maqsood. There's a mix-up between the wickets. Maqsood aims to just run in and tip the bails off. Then realises he doesn't have enough time, attempts an under-arm throw and makes a royal mess of it. Poor judgement from the fielder, think he had time to simply run in and break the stumps. Pressure can make you do strange things
Talat steps out, manufactures a full-toss, and drills it away through the covers. Fetch that
full and nibbles away past the outside edge
much shorter and bends away outside off, Talat hangs his bat out and is beaten on the outside edge again
Asif Ali steps out, this seems like a short googly, hits the pad and rolls away to backward point. There's a mix-up between the wickets but Talat is quick to undo his steps at the non-striker's end
shorter and spins away outside off - legbreak - Tahir finds extra bounce and has Ali feathering it behind. Sanga rides the bounce and takes it smartly

Tahir sets off on back-to-back celebratory sprints. He has turned the chase. This was another full wrong'un, Russell does not pick the variation - it breaks back in sharply - Russell has a short stride and plays outside the line for the legbreak. He is hit below the knee-roll on the front pad in line with middle. No bat involved, Ultraedge defects nothing. But was it spinning down leg? The tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump. Tahir claims the big wicket of Russell and is on a hat-trick. Scenes in Dubai

tossed-up googly, draws the batsman forward, and breaks away past the outside edge. Sanga whips the bails off in a flash. The back leg is grounded and Ashraf survives. Tahir thought he had got Ashraf and set off on a sprint. Mute the celebration
pushed through on off, defended back to the bowler
another ripping googly, the length is very full, lures Ashraf forward and beats the outside edge
drifting down the leg side, tickled away fine past the keeper. Irfan chases from short fine leg, dives in installments, and stops the ball from reaching the boundary
loopy offbreak on off, driven in the air.... but wide of Pollard at short cover
tossed up and drifts in, Ashraf steps out, and misses a big slog. Sanga is beaten as well, missing a stumping chance. It's all happening in Dubai
flat dart on off, pushed back to Malik
full and straight, worked off the pads to deep midwicket
tossed on off, sliced off the outside half to point
short skidder on off, punched to long-off. Malik's front foot has strayed
fired outside leg, grazes the pad and rolls to short fine leg
back of a length and snakes back in, but does not threaten off, left alone
short on top of off, dabbed to cover-point for one
rising short ball outside off, steered off the face to third man
back of a length, starts outside off and bounces over middle, left alone on length
short on off, forced to deep point
short and outside off, swivels on the back foot and pulls away to deep midwicket
dragged short and outside off, muscled to sweeper cover
flighted on middle and spins away, check-driven in front of short cover
full and straight, worked to deep midwicket
slider, fizzes in to hit him high on the thigh pad
full, straight ball, Ashraf plays around his front pad and misses it. Might have slid down leg. Not given. Multan have used up their reviews
another arm ball, snakes in, inside-edged onto the pad
flat on middle and leg, speared to wide long-on for one
full and outside off, caressed off the front foot to sweeper cover
short, wide, cut to sweeper cover off the back foot
dragged down outside off, flat-batted back to Tahir, the ball bursts out of the bowler's hands
on a length and outside off, straightens and moves past the outside edge
dragged short and attached with plenty of width outside off, cracked in the gap between backward point and short third man
tossed up at off and spins away, slices a drive in the air but to the left of backward point
short on off, worked away behind square to short fine leg
yorker on middle, dug out
on a length and outside off, steps out and swings to deep cover
quicker offbreak outside off, Talat charges out with purpose and launches it over extra cover. This goes all the way
Talat steps out, shorter on off, stabbed to point
back of a length and outside off, chopped to backward point
Talat surges down the track again, this time he hoists it straighter. He meets a length ball outside off, extends his hands, and sends the ball soaring over the long-off boundary
short-armed off the hips to deep square leg
short on off, flat-batted down the ground for one
Talat clears the boundary, again! Short and outside off, he picks up the length quickly. He swivels on the back foot and middles a pull over the square leg boundary
slower bouncer just outside off, Talat ventures outside leg, swings and does not make contact
short and angling away outside off from round the wicket, jabbed to backward point
short and cramps the batsman for room, nudged to midwicket
full and skidding into leg stump, tickled off the pads through backward square leg

Talat wins it for Islamabad United. He eases the helmet off the head, thumps his back, and kisses the helmet in celebration. He puts Islamabad on board and consigns Multan to their first loss. He ventures away outside leg stump and disdainfully clubs it over backward point to wrap up things
